page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: {RELIGION} There are four churches in the area and two church halls.. One of the church halls used to be a church. It was deconsecrated as the church of St Andrew and is now{St Andrew's Church {Hall}used by the whole community. Pershore itself is divided into the parish areas of{St Andrew's and Holy {Cross.} There is a{Baptist Church, a {Quaker Meeting House and a modern {Roman Catholic Church of the Holy {Redeemer.} The Anglican{Abbey Church } of the Holy Cross dates back over 1000 years and is witness to the strong christian traditions of this community A{Covenant}exists between the churches and an Ecumenical spirit is most apparent within the christian community. Anglican village churches are found at Birlingham and Wick.
